required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Association Between Treatment Adherence and Treatment Adherence in Sleep Apnea (SEMSAS)
clinical_study.official_title: Association Between Treatment Perception and Treatment Adherence in Obstructive Sleep Apnea Patients Treated by Continuous Positive Airway Pressure (SEMSAS Study)

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of the study is to define an optimal threshold of the SEMSA-15 scale for obstructive sleep apnea (OSA) perception in patients with OSA to predict 3-month and 1-year continuous positive airway pressure adherence.

primary_outcome.description: To define an optimal threshold for the Self-efficacy Measure for Sleep Apnea (SEMSA-15) scale to predict 3-month CPAP adherence
To define an optimal threshold for the Self-efficacy Measure for Sleep Apnea (SEMSA-15) scale to predict 1-year CPAP adherence

secondary_outcome.measure: To compute an overall score to predict CPAP adherence
secondary_outcome.description: Use Self-efficacy Measure for Sleep Apnea (SEMSA-15) scale and socio-economics parameter from patients to improve CPAP adherence prediction

secondary_outcome.measure: To study the impact of health litteracy on CPAP adherence
secondary_outcome.description: Use of Health Litteracy Questionnaire HLQ

secondary_outcome.measure: To study the impact of precariousness on CPAP adherence
secondary_outcome.description: Use of Deprivation in Primary Care (DIPCARE-Q) questionnaire

secondary_outcome.measure: To study the impact of patient quality of life on CPAP adherence
secondary_outcome.description: Use of simplified Short-Form (SF-36) questionnaire for quality of life (SF-12 questionnaire)

secondary_outcome.measure: To construct an overall predictive model of CPAP adherence
To assess the interactions between CPAP adherence trajectories and patients parameters
to assess the improvement of quality of life according to health litteracy and precariousness
Define patient phenotype according all collected variables
secondary_outcome.description: Clinical and socio-demographic phenotype at CPAP initiation

study_pop.textblock: Population will be screened by clinicians (pulmonologists) in ambulatory medicine

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Obstructive Sleep apnea diagnosed, whatever the initial severity and treated with CPAP
- Voluntary patient
- patient in the national healthcare insurance system
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patient with central sleep apnea
- Treatment other than CPAP
- Person with liberty privation or under legal protection
